dt: {bc}a pathological swelling or enlargement (as of a rheumatic joint)
{bc}a discrete mass of one kind of tissue enclosed in tissue of a different kind
{bc}either of the two points where the orbit of a planet or comet intersects the ecliptic
{bc}either of the points at which the orbit of an earth satellite crosses the plane of the equator
{bc}a point, line, or surface of a vibrating body or system that is free or relatively free from vibratory motion
{bc}a point at which a wave has an amplitude of zero
{bc}a point at which subsidiary parts originate or center
{bc}a point on a stem at which a leaf or leaves are inserted
{bc}a point at which a curve intersects itself in such a manner that the branches have different tangents

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}nodus{/it} knot, node; akin to Middle Irish {it}naidm{/it} bond
shortdef: a pathological swelling or enlargement (as of a rheumatic joint)
a discrete mass of one kind of tissue enclosed in tissue of a different kind
an entangling complication (as in a drama) : predicament

dt: {bc}a small gap in the myelin sheath of a myelinated nerve fiber

shortdef: a small gap in the myelin sheath of a myelinated nerve fiber

dt: {bc}a small mass of tissue in the right atrioventricular region of higher vertebrates through which impulses from the sinus node are passed to the ventricles

shortdef: a small mass of tissue in the right atrioventricular region of higher vertebrates through which impulses from the sinus node are passed to the ventricles

dt: {bc}any of the rounded masses of lymphoid tissue that are surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue, are distributed along the lymphatic vessels, and contain numerous lymphocytes which filter the flow of lymph passing through the node

shortdef: any of the rounded masses of lymphoid tissue that are surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue, are distributed along the lymphatic vessels, and contain numerous lymphocytes which filter the flow of lymph passing through the node

dt.t: Kawasaki disease (KD), also known as {wi}mucocutaneous lymph node syndrome{/wi}, is an acute systemic vasculitis seen in the pediatric population.

dt: {bc}a small mass of tissue that is embedded in the musculature of the right atrium of higher vertebrates and that originates the impulses stimulating the heartbeat

shortdef: a small mass of tissue that is embedded in the musculature of the right atrium of higher vertebrates and that originates the impulses stimulating the heartbeat
